tmf
[Groovy] Class Sn

java.lang.Object
  tmf.Sn

class Sn

A Structural Node is the parent class of all the structural nodes (i.e. XML nodes of the GMT format), namely Ci, Gis, Ls, Tdc, Tcs, Te and Ts classes. It is defined in ISO 16642. Note: This class should be considered abstract. No Sn object should be created.

Authors:
Stephane Aubry
See Also:
Ci
Gis
Ls
Tdc
Tcs
Te
Ts

Field Detail

children

protected Map children
children is the list of Structural Nodes which depend upon the current object. Keys of the map entries are ids of the Structural Nodes objects.

id

protected String id
id is the identifier of the object. It is used for links between Sn objects.

informationUnits

protected List informationUnits
informationUnits is the content of the object. e.g. a definition attached to a Terminological Entry. An instance of an Information Unit is attached to one and only one Structural Node.
See Also:
Iu

Adds an Information Unit as content of the current object.
Parameters:
iu - The content Information Unit object
See Also:
Iu

add

def add(Sn child)
Adds a child Structural Node to the current object. A child is one level lower in the dependency hierarchy.
Parameters:
child - The child Structural Node object

equals

@Override
boolean equals(Object obj)
Tests whether two Structural Nodes are equal.
Parameters:
obj - The equality operand
Returns:
True if the two Structural Nodes are equal, false otherwise.
